channel.title: Updates on dotJAR - Development Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Updates on dotJAR - Development Blog

item.title: Client and SAML2
item.description:
Client and SAML2


Meeting Summary

On April 3, the team met with the client to discuss the SAML2 authentication integration. We asked a series of technical questions to clarify the requirements and ensure that everything was aligned. With their guidance, Jael Gonzalez was able to successfully implement the SAML2 authentication into the platform. The following key points were discussed:

  1. Client Meeting â€“ We met with the client to go over the technical aspects of the SAML2 integration.
  2. SAML2 Authentication â€“ After thorough discussion and clarification of the technical details, the team successfully got the SAML2 authentication working on the platform.
  3. Development Progress â€“ Members continued working on their respective parts, making good progress. Each module is moving forward as planned.

Meeting Schedule

  • Date: [04/03/2025]
  • Time: 2:30pm
  • Location: In Person, CTI office

Attendees

  • Angel Aquino
  • Jael Gonzalez
  • Ramon Rosario
  • Andres Rosado

Agenda & Discussion

  1. SAML2 Authentication â€“ Finalizing the implementation after meeting with the client and addressing all questions.
  2. Client Feedback â€“ The client provided guides to ensure proper integration of auth.
  3. Team Progress â€“ The team members continue to make good progress on their respective parts, with most tasks on track.

Tasks

  1. SAML2 Integration â€“ Ensure that the authentication system is fully implemented and integrated with the platform.
  2. Development Work â€“ Continue working on individual modules, focusing on completing the remaining tasks efficiently.

Next Meeting

Date: 04/07/2025

item.title: Gantt Chart Rework and Process Discussion
item.description:
Gantt Chart Rework and Process Discussion


Meeting Summary

In todayâ€™s meeting, the team discussed the challenges with the current Gantt chart, particularly its waterfall structure, however, a gantt chart is required for the project.

  1. Gantt Chart Rework â€“ The Gantt chart was restructured with the provided feedback, but its waterfall nature is still limiting the flexibility required for this project.
  2. Ongoing Development â€“ Despite these process challenges, the team continues to develop their respective parts, focusing on the completion of their individual modules.

Meeting Schedule

  • Date: [03/18/2025]
  • Time: 8:30pm - 10:30pm
  • Location: Online

Attendees

  • Angel Aquino
  • Jael Gonzalez
  • Ramon Rosario

Agenda & Discussion

  1. Rework of Gantt Chart â€“ Discussed the limitations of the waterfall structure and agreed that it was impeding progress in certain areas.
  2. Waterfall Challenges â€“ The waterfall approach was seen as problematic, with issues arising from strict task sequencing and lack of flexibility.
  3. Development Progress â€“ The team members continue to work on their parts, with a focus on completing key development tasks.

Tasks

  1. Gantt Chart Rework â€“ Continue to adjust and test the updated Gantt chart format while considering the transition to a Kanban chart.
  2. Task Development â€“ Continue the development of individual modules with a focus on completing the backend and front-end components.

Next Meeting

Date: 03/24/2025

item.title: Continuation
item.description:
Continuing The Progress


Meeting Summary

The team continues to have daily meetings and working on the progress report. There’s some delay on the backend, however, a new task has been created indicated ‘catching up’ with the delayed tasks and continue to work smoothly. If the mentioned is not met, tasks will have to be shifted and fixed to accomodate to a new schedule.

The team prepares for the Happy Hour Oral Exam.

item.title: Progress and Presentation
item.description:
Progress, Report and Presentaiton

Meeting Summary

In this meeting multiple updates were given and reported, as well as continuing to work in the progress report 1 and its presentaiton.

  1. All the tasks related to the front-end were completed, including wireframes, a site map, and the componenets to be used. Development of the HTML and CSS implenention was about to start.
  2. The tasks related to the database were completed, a schema of the tables and the Entety Relation Diagram were completed.
  3. The front end was reported to be behind. This was hugely due to technical debt, in other words, the amount of time required to develop expertise in this area was longer than expected, and thus the design for route and controllers was behind.

Other than this, the members continued to work on the progress report and the presentation.

item.title: Client Meeting
item.description:
Client Meeting


Meeting Summary

Every thursday the team members have a meeting with the clients regarding updates and status, particularly important information was discusssed in this meeting:

  1. The wireframes were shown to the client
  2. The client provided information on the tools, in this case specifically kits and libraries, used for the integration of the authentication used in UPRM.

Meeting Schedule

  • Date: [03/07/2025]
  • Time: 10:30am - 12pm
  • Location: In Person, CTI office

Attendees

  • Angel Aquino
  • Jael Gonzalez
  • Ramon Rosario
  • Martin Menendex
  • Andres Rosado

Agenda & Discussion

  • The addition of letter generation -> It was determined the platform will include a system to automatically generate (using a template) the approval cards for associations.
  • Two new dependices -> It was determined that the laravel\breeze kit will be used for scaffol and socialiteprovider\saml2 will be used for SAML2 integration.

Next Meeting

Date: 03/09/2025

item.title: Latest Meetings
item.description:
Latest Meetings


Since the team does daily meetings, it’s hard to keep track to the minute detail, however the following has happened:

  1. Had a meeting with the client were the topic of the SRS was talked about, as well as other topics.
  2. The SRS document was submitted by the group.

From now on, we will follow the recommended template. However, the formatting is bound to change eventually for a cleaner look.

item.title: Reworking Meetings
item.description:
Reworking Meetings Format

Last week the team finish and submitted the proposal report.

As per requirement from the course, a new structure for meetings will be implemented. The formating is the following:

Meeting Summary
Date: [MM/DD/YYYY]
Time: [Start - End]
Location: [Physical/Virtual]

Attendees
[Name 1], [Name 2], [Name 3], etc.
Agenda & Discussion
[Agenda Item 1] â€“ [Key points, decisions, action items]
[Agenda Item 2] â€“ [Key points, decisions, action items]
[Agenda Item 3] â€“ [Key points, decisions, action items]
Action Items
Task	Owner	Deadline
[Task 1]	[Person 1]	[MM/DD/YYYY]
[Task 2]	[Person 2]	[MM/DD/YYYY]
Next Meeting
Date/Time: [MM/DD/YYYY, HH:MM]

Given that the team has daily meetings, the updates of the blog will be uploaded daily.

item.title: Working the Proposal
item.description:
Working on the Proposal

There’s not much update on the project itself. The team remain workings on the proposal report.

Other than this the team has been looking into tools for designing Gantt charts since OpenLibre seems old and clunky.

Also, the team has been learning about Laravel through Laracast, a website that goes from learning the most basic PHP to complex topics and finally to the Laravel framework.

That’s all for now,

item.title: Finished Setup
item.description:
The Setup


After much work, the blog has finally been setup and hosted on GitHub Pages.

Here’s a brief update on the project’s progress so far:

  • Multiple meetings have been held with the clients.
  • An oral proposal presentation was delivered to the class.

Moving forward, regular updates will be provided on important milestones and meetings.

- dotJAR team ðŸ«™

Initial post for dotJAR development blog.
